episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of intriguing topics, including Japanese slang for retired husbands, a 35-second play by Samuel Beckett, the non-existent European road E-404, and the mysterious white coyotes of Newfoundland.

facts.fact: One Japanese slang term for a retired husband is soraigomi, which literally translates as bulky waste.
In 1969, Samuel Beckett wrote a play that lasts 35 seconds long and features no actors or any dialogue.
The European road, called E-404, doesn't exist.
In 2001 in Newfoundland, a golden retriever chased after a coyote and was never seen again.
